intro: Tiquiliopsis, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the Asteraceae family. It is native to Mexico and parts of Central America, where it thrives in sunny, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its vibrant orange to red flowers, which bloom in the summer months. Tiquiliopsis species are often used in ornamental gardening due to their attractive appearance and ease of cultivation. They also play a role in supporting local pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
